Label: obsolete intracellular cytokine staining assay
Definition: The measurement of cytokines within the cytoplasm of a cell by permeabilizing the cell membrane to allow entry of specific antibodies, and counting the stained cells using a flow cytometer.
Example of Usage: Permeabilizing T cells and staining them with fluorescent labeled anti-IFN-gamma antibodies

Label: obsolete MHC multimer staining assay
Definition: An MHC multimer assay is an assay that detects T cells capable of binding the MHC:ligand complexes present in the multimer. The multimer is fluorescently labelled. The T cells bound to multimers are counted in a flow cytometer
Example of Usage: Measuring T cells that are specific for the SYFPEITHI peptide when presented by the murine MHC molecule H-2 Kd by staining them with a tetramer of peptide loaded MHC complexes.

Label: obsolete intracellular material detection by flow cytometry assay
Definition: An assay in which the presence of a material inside a cell is measured by permeabilizing the cell membrane to allow entry of specific antibodies, and counting the stained cells using a flow cytometer.

Label: obsolete intracellular material detection by flow cytometry assay  of epitope specific cytotoxic T cell degranulation
Definition: An intracellular material detection by flow cytometry assay  that measures epitope specific cytotoxic T cell degranulation
Term Editor: PERSON:Randi Vita, Jason Greenbaum, Bjoern Peters
IEDB Alternative Terms: T cell degranulation by intracellular staining

Label: obsolete T cell recognition of eluted MHC ligand assay
Definition: An assay that identifies an MHC ligand using a T cell response assay as a readout
Example of Usage: Using proliferation of a T cell line specific for SIINFEKL in response to material eluted from a cell as evidence that SIINFEKL was presented by MHC on that cell.

Label: obsolete cell lysate MHC binding constant determination assay
Definition: An assay that measures the affinity of a ligand to a MHC in a cell lysate preparation and that quantifies the affinity with a binding constant.

Label: obsolete cell bound MHC binding constant determination assay
Definition: An assay that measures the affinity of a ligand to MHC moleculs bound to the cell surface and that quantifies the affinity with a binding constant.

Label: obsolete cell lysate MHC competitive binding assay using radioactivity detection
Definition: competitive inhibition of binding assay measuring MHC ligand binding by radioactivity detection using MHC derived from a cell lysate
Term Editor: PERSON:Randi Vita, Jason Greenbaum, Bjoern Peters
IEDB Alternative Terms: cell lysate MHC competitive binding using radioactivity

Label: obsolete purified MHC binding constant determination assay
Definition: An assay that measures the affinity of a ligand to a purified MHC complex preparation and that quantifies the affinity with a binding constant.

Label: obsolete cell bound MHC direct binding assay
Definition: direct binding assay measuring MHC ligand binding using MHC derived from a cell
Term Editor: PERSON:Randi Vita, Jason Greenbaum, Bjoern Peters

Label: obsolete purified MHC direct binding assay
Definition: direct binding assay measuring MHC ligand binding using MHC derived from a purified MHC molecule preparation
Term Editor: PERSON:Randi Vita, Jason Greenbaum, Bjoern Peters

Label: obsolete B cell epitope direct binding assay
Definition: A direct binding assay using a assay
Term Editor: PERSON:Randi Vita, Jason Greenbaum, Bjoern Peters

Label: obsolete B cell epitope competitive binding assay
Definition: A competitive inhibition of binding assay using a assay
Term Editor: PERSON:Randi Vita, Jason Greenbaum, Bjoern Peters

Label: obsolete B cell epitope specific X-ray crystallography assay
Definition: A X-ray crystallography assay measuring epitope specfic antibody binding event in angstroms
Term Editor: PERSON:Randi Vita, Jason Greenbaum, Bjoern Peters
